Hell, maybe it should have been her outright raping him(as he wouldn't have fought her off for some reason...maybe not wanting to hurt her or something as he seems like that kind of person)...and ending with her realizing she became what she hated...

@MyDickIsSolid We did kinda see her become an abuser, herself. I mean, she technically forced herself on the teacher and didn't care when he said to stop. The only reason this wasn't a rape is because he relented and fucked her like she wanted. I doubt she would have stopped if he put his foot down, too. He would have had to get a little aggressive to keep her off him...which she could have probably turned around and made it seem like he attempted to rape her(she probably would have been resentful in this scenario had he refused her advances to the end). This is even more why I feel the teacher should have quit at the end...she needed to learn the lesson that what she did was not okay and had negative impacts.

I think this story should have, indeed, ended with him quitting being a teacher or at least moving away because he feels he failed as a teacher and can't be around her. It seems more in line with how the author had him as a straight-laced character in the beginning. Maybe have him leave a letter behind for her, too, so she knows why he left. It would show her that her prejudice had negative effects on those around her. Even if the ending wouldn't have been as heartwarming, it would be more impactful. More meaningful, too.

Hyperssexuality is fairly common between rape victims, as a way for the brain to cope with the trauma. It is believeable that the victim does so in order to feel like he/she took control of the situation, but the reality is the complete opposite. If untreated, victims with hyperssexuality most of the times devolves depression and anxiety, and the treatment itself depends on the severity of the symdrome, going from medicine and therapy to, in case of risk of the patient harming others, the internment of the patient/victim. It is important to note that there's high chances of a victim of rape becoming a rapist or a pedophile him/herself, wich is the most severe of the cases of hyperssexuality.

I just came to check out a new story, but the plot and emotional arc got me HOOKED way harder than I think any doujinshi ever has.  The way she initially saw the new teacher honestly hurt my heart because of how much fear and hurt she was carrying around, and when she broke down in his office and received warmth in response... good shit.

OF course, there's a lot of stuff to make it hentai that make it a bit less heartwarming (like her sexually assaulting him and him. just. going with it), but the actual characterization and messaging were bizarrely solid. 

The art was also strong throughout, both in terms of emotional conveyance and hot. Both of the leads look consistently good.

As for the actual translators - the localization seems really good! So just... good job to everyone involved in the original project and the translation, I guess!
